items.title: Is PayPal’s New Fiat Platform a Stablecoin Killer?
items.summary: PayPal World aims to link major digital wallets domestically, potentially challenging stablecoins, although legacy constraints could be a limiting factor.

items.title: Auditing challenges
items.summary: A decade since audit rotation, there are challenges to auditing practices that present an opportunity to reset and improve. Auditors are facing new challenges related to AI technology and regulation, requiring innovation in auditing processes.

items.title: AI mainframe sales help IBM breeze past the Street’s targets on earnings and revenue
items.summary: AI mainframe sales help IBM exceed expectations on second-quarter earnings and revenue, driven by strong sales of new hardware capable of processing large amounts of data, particularly beneficial for AI workloads.

items.title: AI mainframe sales help IBM beat Street’s earnings targets, but software miss upsets investors
items.summary: IBM beat earnings targets with strong AI mainframe sales, but upset investors with a software miss, resulting in a stock decline.

items.title: Why these 5 pharma stocks could shine in today’s trade: July 24, 2025
items.summary: Dr Reddy’s, Apollo Hospitals, and Natco Pharma are showcasing advancements in pharmaceuticals through innovation in liver healthcare, financial updates, and acquisition plans for Adcock Ingram.

items.title: Veeva と AWS が 10 年にわたる関係を拡大｜AWS 、Veeva の「 AI パートナー」に。更なる協業で、共通の顧客の成功を支援
items.summary: Veeva and AWS expand their 10-year relationship, with AWS becoming Veeva's 'AI partner'. Through further collaboration, they aim to support the success of their common customers.

items.summary: ONNX Runtime accelerator onnxruntime-migraphx has been added to PyPI, providing efficient runtime for Machine Learning models.

items.title: From search to smart glasses: Alphabet bets big on AI agents
items.summary: Alphabet is making big bets on AI agents, with CEO Sundar Pichai mentioning the positive impact of AI on their business, including the adoption of Gemini models and user engagement with smart glasses. They are also strengthening ties with OpenAI.

items.title: DNI Gabbard claims ‘deep state actors’ didn’t want Trump-Russia information to 'see the light of day'
items.summary: DNI Gabbard accuses 'deep state actors' of withholding Trump-Russia information, DOJ to look into potential criminal investigation based on declassified documents.

items.title: Asian shares rise on hopes for more trade deals
items.summary: Asian shares rise for the sixth consecutive day on hopes for more trade deals, following optimism surrounding potential US trade agreements with Japan and the European Union.

items.title: Pichai: AI Overviews Top 2 Billion Users and Boost Search by 10%
items.summary: Alphabet raises its projected capital expenditures to $85 billion, with Google's CEO Pichai stating that AI now reaches over 2 billion users and has boosted search by 10%.

items.title: CNBC Daily Open: Investors loosen their purse strings for Alphabet's increased spending
items.summary: Investors are increasing investment in Alphabet's AI spending, confident that it will lead to higher revenue.

items.title: pygpt-net 2.5.65
items.summary: pygpt-net 2.5.65 is a Desktop AI Assistant powered by various OpenAI models such as GPT-4, DALL-E, and others, supporting chatbot capabilities, image generation, vision analysis, and more.

items.title: SK Hynix rides DRAM wave, doubles down on HBM with capex boost
items.summary: SK Hynix reported second-quarter 2025 revenue of KRW22.23 trillion (US$16.17 billion), up 35% year-over-year, driven by surging demand for AI and high-performance DRAM. The company plans to boost capex to meet growing demand for HBM and AI memory products.

items.title: How the White House AI plan helps, and hurts, in the race against China
items.summary: The White House AI plan has been seen as both beneficial and concerning in the competition against China, with one tech advocate praising it as crucial while another viewing it as a Silicon Valley wishlist.

items.title: Alphabet opens its wallet for AI supremacy
items.summary: Alphabet Inc. reports strong financial results in second quarter of 2025, with double-digit revenue growth and increased capital expenditures, emphasizing its focus on AI technology.

items.title: Inside the debate over teens using AI companions for support
items.summary: A new study by Common Sense Media shows many younger teens are using AI companions for support. The nonprofit's founder and CEO, Jim Steyer, discusses the findings.

items.title: The Hidden Value Of Anecdotes, Anomalies And Outliers
items.summary: Nearly all breakthrough ideas and innovations start at the edges, not the mainstream. Brands are not leveraging outliers that deviate from the norm.

items.summary: Trump's AI action plan could lead to a 'Silicon Valley free-for-all', raising questions about whether Canada will adopt a corporate-friendly approach or opt for stricter regulations like the EU.

items.title: Trump Says It Is ‘Not Do-able’ for AI Companies to Pay for All Copyrighted Content Used in Training Models
items.summary: President Trump believes it is not feasible for AI companies to pay for all copyrighted content used in training models, citing that China is not doing it. This raises ethical questions regarding the use of copyrighted materials in AI development.

items.title: AI and the great digital agency unbundling
items.summary: AI is leading to a shift in the digital agency landscape, moving from manual processes to more efficient automated tools. While expertise is still needed to maximize the benefits of AI, the reliance on traditional methods is decreasing.

items.summary: teraace-tracker, a Python library for tracking AI agent events, has been added to PyPI to support LangChain, CrewAI, and AutoGPT frameworks.
